ESP.ORIGINAL:
Atlas Map Markers SE - Version 2.7
Allows both new and vanilla map markers to be controlled via a Mod Configuration Menu. Allows compass markers and settings to be adjusted via MCM.

ESP.ORIGINAL:
The Dragonborn DLC has 4 very hard to reach Hidden Peak map markers on the map. They are normally disabled until you find each peak. These markers can be enabled to allow you to find them easier, like a normal location.
Do you want to change these locations?
ESP.TRADUIT:
Le DLC Dragonborn comporte 4 cimes très difficiles d'accès. Les marqueurs de ces dernières sont normalement désactivés jusqu'à ce que vous les trouviez. Ces marqueurs peuvent être activés pour vous permettre de les trouver plus facilement, comme un repère normal.
Souhaitez-vous modifier ces repères ?

ESP.ORIGINAL: This will make all of the active Imperial and Stormcloak base camps show on the map as Undiscovered places. Making them easier to find as they change while the civil war rages on. There are 16 camps and only the active ones will be visible. WARNING! This action can not be undone.
ESP.TRADUIT: Tous les camps actifs des Impériaux et des Sombrages apparaîtront sur la carte en tant que lieux non découverts. Les rendant plus faciles à trouver pendant la guerre civile. Il existe 16 camps et seuls les camps actifs seront visibles. ATTENTION ! Cette action ne peut pas être annulée.

ESP.ORIGINAL: Atlas Map Markers is still updating the map with your previous selections.\n\nYou must wait until it is finished before altering the settings.

WARNING!
Setting an option to 'Discovered' or 'Undiscovered' will apply those markers to the map.

You can't change a location back to 'Default' behavior once it is shown on the map. Once they appear on the map, markers can be removed only by completely Disabling them.
DEFAULT\nMarkers are enabled but remain hiddened until you discover them.

UNDISCOVERED
Markers are enabled and shown on the map, but they are not available for fast travel until you discover them.

WARNING!
You can't change a location back to 'Default' once it is shown on the map.

DISCOVERED
Markers are enabled and immediately available for fast travel.

WARNING!
You can't change a location back to 'Default' once it is shown on the map.
DISABLED\nMarkers are disabled and removed from the map. You cannot discover them, and they will not become visible when you approach the location.

Fast-traveling to Jorrvaskr during certain Companions' quests may bypass quest triggers and result in broken quests. While doing the Companions questline, it is recommended that you enter Whiterun using the main city gates to avoid these issues.

These markers are related to various quests. Revealing these markers may result in quest spoilers, and fast-traveling to these locations prior to reaching the related quest stage could potentially break certain quest functions.\n\nDo you want to change these markers?

The fast travel marker for Solstheim is normally disabled until after the player first travels to Solstheim via ship. Setting these map markers to Discovered will allow you to fast travel to Solstheim before completing this initial quest and could potentially break some quest functions. It is recommended that you first travel to Solstheim via boat as intended.\n\nDo you want to change these markers?

Two of these map markers are normally disabled until the player has reached a certain point in the Dawnguard quest. Fast-traveling to these markers prior to reaching the related quest stage could potentially break some quest functions. It is recommended that you wait until these map markers are discovered through natural game play before fast traveling to these locations.\n\nDo you want to change these markers?

The map markers for the three Hearthfire building locations are normally disabled until the player has acquired the property. Enabling the map markers will allow you to preview these locations prior to purchase. However, once these markers are visible on the map, they cannot be individually disabled.\n\nDo you want to change these markers?

The map markers for the Great Lifts that access Blackreach are normally disabled until the player has discovered Blackreach. Enabling the map markers will allow them to appear on the map prior to the exploration of Blackreach.\n\nDo you want to change these markers?

The map marker for the Forgotten Vale is normally disabled until the appropriate quest stage. Enabling this map marker will allow you to discover and travel to the Forgotten Vale prior to the related quest and could potentially break some quest functions. It is recommended that you wait until this map marker is enabled by the quest before traveling to the Forgotten Vale.\n\nDo you want to change these markers?

Solstheim has four hard to reach mountain peaks. The map markers for these peaks are normally disabled until you reach the peak. Enabling these markers will allow them to show up on your compass and/or map, allowing you to find them easier.\n\nDo you want to change these markers?

At least one of these markers is intended to remain disabled until the player has completed the relevant quest. While enabling these markers will probably not cause quest issues, it may result in spoilers if you haven't yet completed the related quests.\n\nDo you want to change these markers?

This key will open the Abandoned Sewer, a faster way into the Ragged Flagon. It is normally found inside of the Ragged Flagon. This key will allow you access to the area before you normally would. This may break some quests and should only be used AFTER you have been to the Ragged Flagon.\n\nWould you like the key?
DEFAULT: Markers are enabled but remain hiddened until you discover them.\nDISABLED: Markers are disabled and removed from the map.

WARNING: Once a location has been shown on the map, it can't be changed back to use 'Default' behavior.
DEFAULT: Markers are enabled but remain hiddened until you discover them.
UNDISCOVERED: Markers are enabled and shown on the map, but are not yet available for fast-travel.
DISCOVERED: Markers are enabled and shown on the map, and are available for fast travel.
DISABLED: Markers are disabled and removed from the map.

By default, the marker options are restricted to simply enabling and disabling the markers. These two settings can generally be easily reversed at any time (exceptions have individual confirmation messages).\nBy disabling this option, you will have access to two additional settings (Discovered and Undiscovered), which will display the markers on your map. However, these are irreversable options, and once markers are displayed on the map, they can not be reverted to the Default behavior.
-- Primary Cities and Hold Capitals --\n11 markers (9 in Skyrim, 2 in Solstheim)
-- Palaces and Keeps --\n5 markers (Blue Palace, Dragonsreach, Palace of the Kings, Mistveil Keep, and Understone Keep)
-- Docks, located both inside and outside of cities --\n5 markers (Solitude Docks, Windhelm Docks, Dawnstar Docks, Icewater Jetty and Northshore Landing in Solstheim)
-- Locations Related to the Thieves Guild --\n3 markers
-- Locations Related to theDark Brotherhood --\n2 markers
-- Additional Locations --\n2 markers (College of Winterhold and Solitude Lighthouse)
-- Places of Note --\n4 markers (Castle Dour, the Skyforge, the Bards College, and The Chill)
-- Locations Related to the College of Winterhold --\n4 markers (Arch-Mage Quarters and the 3 Halls)
-- Locations Related to the Companions --\n1 marker (Jorrvaskr)

-- Locations Related to theDark Brotherhood --\n1 marker (alternate Sanctuary exit)\nNOTE: Even with this option enabled, the marker will remain hidden until you have completed the related quest stage.
-- Inns located within Major Cities --\n6 markers
-- Shops located within Major Cities --\n19 markers
-- Market Districts within Major Cities --\n4 markers
-- Additional Locations in the Major Cities --\n7 markers (Thalmor Headquarters, Honorhall Orphanage, New Gnisis Cornerclub, the Great Porch, Calixto's, Markarth Treasury, and Plankside in Riften)
-- Towns and Villages --\n9 markers (8 in Skyrim, 1 in Solstheim)
-- Houses and Small Settlements --\n12 markers (Darkwater Crossing, Goldenglow, Hall of the Vigilant, Nightgate Inn, Old Hroldan, Black Briar Lodge, etc.)
-- Farms and Grain Mills --\n12 markers (11 in Skyrim, 1 in Solstheim)
-- Mines --\n11 markers (9 in Skyrim, 2 in Solstheim)
-- Places of Note --\n4 markers (Northstar Port, Dawnstar Lighthouse, the Penitus Oculatus Outpost, and the Telvanni Tower)
-- Inns located outside the major cities --\n10 markers
-- Shops located outside the major cities --\n14 markers
-- Additional Locations --\n12 markers (Jarls' Longhouses, 7000 Steps, Morthal Cemetery, Silus Vesuius's House, Goldenglow Estate Sewer)
-- Campsites --\n13 markers (9 in Skyrim, 4 in Solstheim)
-- Shrines of the Daedric Princes --\n6 markers
-- Altars --\n2 markers (1 in Skyrim, 1 in Solstheim)
-- Ponds, Clearings and Groves --\n11 markers (9 in Skyrim, 2 in Solstheim)
-- Shacks and Dilapidated Houses --\n18 markers (15 in Skyrim, 3 in Solstheim)
-- Dragon Lairs --\n11 markers (10 in Skyrim, 1 in Solstheim)
-- Ships & Shipwrecks --\n10 markers (9 in Skyrim, 1 in Solstheim)
-- Topographical Landmarks, such as peaks, overlooks, and cliffs --\n7 markers (8 in Skyrim, 1 in Solstheim)
-- Wilderness Campsites --\n47 markers (hunter camps, bandit camps, Forsworn camps, etc.)
-- Shrines of the Nine Divines --\n29 markers
-- Wayshrines located along the 7000 Steps --\n10 markers
-- Dragon Mounds --\n25 markers (23 in Skyrim, 2 in Solstheim)
-- Animal Dens --\n19 markers (16 in Skyrim, 3 in Solstheim)
-- Waterways and Bodies of Water --\n15 markers (11 in Skyrim, 4 in Solstheim)
-- Dungeon Exits --\n42 markers (39 in Skyrim, 2 in Solstheim)
-- Hard to find Skill Books --\n20 markers
-- Shipwrecks --\n10 markers (7 in Skyrim, 3 in Solstheim)
-- Forts, Towers, Shacks & Other Structures --\n9 markers
-- Ruins, Surface Rubble, and Burial Mounds --\n26 markers
-- Topographical Landmarks, such as peaks, passes, and cliffs --\n14 markers (9 in Skyrim, 5 in Solstheim)
-- Points of Interest --\n72 markers (hidden chests, corpses and other small details encountered in the wilderness)
-- The Great Lifts to Blackreach from Skyrim --\n4 markers
-- Great Lifts and Primary Access Points --\n7 markers
-- Important Buildings and Structures within Blackreach --\n10 markers
-- Points of Interest within Blackreach --\n9 markers
-- Primary Locations related to the two main Dawnguard factions --\n4 markers (Fort Dawnguard and Volkihar Castle)
-- Additional Locations related to the two Dawnguard factions --\n5 markers (Dayspring Canyon, Mossy Glen Cave, Ruined Docks, and Volkihar Courtyard)
-- Travel to and from the Forgotten Vale and Skyrim --\n2 markers
-- Primary locations and Wayshrines in the Forgotten Vale --\n7 markers
-- Important Portals, Caves, Passages and Landmarks within the Forgotten Vale --\n11 markers
-- Points of Interest encountered within the Forgotten Vale --\n47 markers (animal dens, creatures, corpses, pathways, hidden chests, etc.)
-- Primary locations in the Soul Cairn --\n5 markers (the Boneyard, Keeper locations, and the portal to Castle Volkihar)
-- Other Significant Locations in the Soul Cairn --\n13 markers (Ideal Masters, Reaper's Lair, etc.)
-- Points of Interest in the Soul Cairn --\n37 markers (skeletons, NPCs, smaller structures, pathways, etc.)
-- Travel to Solstheim from Skyrim, and to Skyrim from Solstheim --\n2 markers
-- The Northern Maiden --\n2 markers (Windhelm and Solstheim)
-- Points of Interest on Solstheim --\n28 markers (creatures, corpses, hidden chests, etc.)
-- Active Imperial and Stormcloak Camps --\nUp to 16 markers (there are 16 camps, but only the active ones will be visible)
-- Forts and Watchtowers --\n38 markers (34 in Skyrim, 4 in Solstheim)
-- Caves --\n73 markers (68 in Skyrim, 5 in Solstheim)
-- Nordic Ruins, Barrows, and Towers --\n61 markers (58 in Skyrim, 3 in Solstheim)
-- Dwemer Ruins --\n14 markers (11 in Skyrim, 3 in Solstheim)
-- Special Locations --\n7 markers (High Hrothgar, Sky Haven Temple, Septimus Signus Outpost, Japhet's Folly, the Temple of Miraak, etc.)
The distance at which the solid markers begin to fade and become smaller.\nDefault Vanilla Value: 10000

The distance at which the markers come into detection range and appear on your compass.
Setting this value to 0 will completely remove all map markers from the compass.
NOTE: You may need to fast travel after changing this setting in order to get the new value to take affect.
Default Vanilla Value: 20000
The maximum size that Map markers will appear on your compass.\nDefault Vanilla Value: 130
The minimum size that Map markers will appear on your compass.\nDefault Vanilla Value: 90
The minimum alpha fade that Map markers will appear on your compass.\nDefault Vanilla Value: 40
The maximum size that Quest markers will appear on your compass.\nDefault Vanilla Value: 150
The minimum size that Quest markers will appear on your compass.\nDefault Vanilla Value: 100
The minimum alpha fade that Quest markers will appear on your compass.\nDefault Vanilla Value: 90
Load a previously saved preset. This custom preset will automatically configure all Compass settings on this page. Map Marker settings are saved as their own independent preset.
Save your current compass settings as a custom preset, allowing you to quickly and easily re-configure the settings when you start a new game. This will save ONLY the compass settings.
Load a previously saved preset. This custom preset will automatically configure all settings EXCEPT the Compass settings. Compass settings are saved as their own independent preset.

Save your current settings as a custom preset, allowing you to quickly and easily re-configure the settings when you start a new game. This will save all of your current settings EXCEPT the Compass settings. Compass settings are saved as their own independent preset.

This will disable most of the vanilla map markers and remove them from the map.\nNOTE: Certain quest-related, initially-disabled, and/or parent-enabled markers will not be affected by this option and must be individually toggled.

This will reset most of the vanilla map markers to their default state (enabled but hidden).\nNOTE: Certain quest-related, initially-disabled, and/or parent-enabled markers will not be affected by this option and must be individually toggled.\nAlso, once a location has been shown on the map, it can't be hidden again except by completely disabling the marker.
This will disable all Atlas map markers and remove them from the map.

This will reset all Atlas map markers to their default state (enabled but hidden).\nNOTE: Once a location has been shown on the map, it can't be hidden again except by completely disabling the marker.
Please be patient; this may take a moment.
Are you sure? Loading this preset will overwrite your existing settings.
Are you sure? This will overwrite the existing preset with your current settings.
FISS is not installed. Loading disabled.
FISS is not installed. Saving disabled.
Your preset has been loaded successfully!
Your settings have been successfully saved!

ESP.IDSTEXTE: ModPosition = game.GetModByName("Unofficial Skyrim Special Edition Patch.esp") USKPTheChillMarker = game.GetFormFromFile(84052050, "Unofficial Skyrim Special Edition Patch.esp")
